meanings.definition: To certify or attest to the authenticity of a document by a notary public.
meanings.sent1: The notary public was notarizing the contract to make it official.
meanings.sent2: She always makes sure to have important papers notarized for legal protection.
meanings.sent3: The notary public joked that notarizing papers was like giving them a legal hug.
meanings.sent4: Notarizing the document was like putting a seal of approval on its validity.
meanings.sent5: The process of notarizing the will made it legally binding and secure.

meanings.definition: The act of having a document officially witnessed and signed by a notary public.
meanings.sent1: Notarizing is an essential step in making sure legal documents are valid.
meanings.sent2: He needed the notarizing of the contract before it could be considered official.
meanings.sent3: The notarizing of the deed felt like getting a stamp of approval from the law.
meanings.sent4: The notarizing of the will was the final touch to ensure its authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The notarizing of the papers gave them the necessary legal weight and credibility.
